Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 観光客
Entry.EnglishText: Tourist

Entry.JapaneseText: 王の盾兵士
Entry.EnglishText: Royal Shield Soldier

Entry.JapaneseText: 男の子
Entry.EnglishText: Boy

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 首都バルカ
Entry.EnglishText: Capital City Balka

Entry.JapaneseText: 首都バルカ
Entry.EnglishText: Capital City Balka

Entry.JapaneseText: 雑貨屋
Entry.EnglishText: General Store

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ジベールの家
Entry.EnglishText: Gibert's Home

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカに来るのは初めてだけど、 どこも霧だらけ……
Entry.EnglishText: It's my first time in Balka and there's just fog everywhere...

Entry.JapaneseText: 方向音痴の僕には、 安心して歩けない町だよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I can't walk around town without worrying I'll up and get lost.
Entry.Notes: I rewrote it, but I want it checked. -dragon

Entry.JapaneseText: あれが機関車というヤツか…… 初めて見るわい。
Entry.EnglishText: So that's what you call a locomotive... I've never seen one before.

Entry.JapaneseText: 近くで見てみたいが、 ちと怖い気もするのう。
Entry.EnglishText: I'd like to see it up close, but it's a bit intimidating.

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギア城が臨時の 避難場所になっている！
Entry.EnglishText: Castle Callegea has become a temporary refuge!

Entry.JapaneseText: 探し人がいるのなら そこに行ってみるといい！
Entry.EnglishText: If you're looking for someone, go there!

Entry.JapaneseText: いつどこでバイラスが 出るかわからない！ 気をつけるんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: You never know when or where a Birus might appear! We have to be careful!

Entry.JapaneseText: 誰か探してるの？ さっき、ここの通りを 逃げてった人かな……？
Entry.EnglishText: Are you looking for someone? Is it the person who ran down this street just now?

Entry.JapaneseText: この街はね、いつもは もっと静かなんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: This city is usually much quieter, you know.

Entry.JapaneseText: 今は儀式の前だから、 外からもたくさん人が 来てるんだよね。
Entry.EnglishText: Now that the ceremony's almost here, there has been an increase in tourists.

Entry.JapaneseText: 儀式の前だから、兵隊さんが たくさんいるんだってさ。
Entry.EnglishText: Also because it's the day before the ceremony, so there's a lot of soldiers.
Entry.Notes: clunky. needs a retranslation, but I'll throw something out that may or may not be correct: "And of course, because the inauguration is near, they've increased security around these parts." -dragon

Entry.JapaneseText: カッコイイよね！ ボクも将来はカレギア軍に 入りたいなぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: They're so cool! I want to join the Callegean army when I grow up.

Entry.JapaneseText: お城に悪いヤツが入ったんだって。 だから、トクベツケイビになって 兵隊さんが増えたんだよ！
Entry.EnglishText: I heard that there was a bad guy found in the castle. That's why they have a special guard and even more soldiers!

Entry.JapaneseText: 兵隊さんたち、 とっても怖い顔してるけど 悪いヤツがいるから仕方ないよね。
Entry.EnglishText: So many soldiers... They look a bit scary. But there are bad guys wandering about, so it can't be helped.

Entry.JapaneseText: おにいさんも怖い顔してるけど、 カレギア軍の人なの？
Entry.EnglishText: You seem tough too, are you from the Callegean army?

Entry.JapaneseText: お城に悪いヤツが入ったんだって。 だから、トクベツケイビになって 兵隊さんが増えたんだよ！
Entry.EnglishText: I heard that there was a bad guy found in the castle. That's why they have a special guard and even more soldiers!

Entry.JapaneseText: 兵隊さんたち、 とっても怖い顔してるけど 悪いヤツがいるから仕方ないよね。
Entry.EnglishText: So many soldiers... They look a bit scary. But there are bad guys wandering about, so it can't be helped.

Entry.JapaneseText: おじさん、強そうだね。 まるで兵隊さんみたい！ カレギア軍に入ればいいのに。
Entry.EnglishText: Mister, you look strong. You're kind of like a soldier! You should join the army.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマなんかと、 話なんかしないよーだ！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not talking to you, Huma!

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、おじさんも ヒューマなんてキライだよね？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, you don't like Huma either, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: ボク、前は少しキライだったけど、 今はスッゴクキライなんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: I used to hate them a little, but now I despise them!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマが近くに来ると、 ボク、イヤな気持ちになるんだ！ だから、どっか行ってよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Whenever a Huma comes near me, I feel sick to my stomach! So please go away!

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、おじさんも ヒューマなんてキライだよね？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, you don't like Huma either, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: ボク、前は少しキライだったけど、 今はスッゴクキライなんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: I used to hate them a little, but now I despise them!

Entry.JapaneseText: ジルバ様がお城でお話をした時に、 「ヒューマは悪い！」って 言ったんだってさ。
Entry.EnglishText: Lady Zilva spoke to me at the castle once before. "Huma are bad!" she said.

Entry.JapaneseText: ボクも前から、ヒューマが 悪いって思ってたんだ。 おじさんもそうだよね？
Entry.EnglishText: I've always thought it was the Huma's fault, too. You do, too, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマが近くに来ると、 ボク、イヤな気持ちになるんだ！ だから、どっか行ってよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Whenever a Huma comes near me, I feel sick to my stomach! So please go away!

Entry.JapaneseText: 悪者のヒューマなんかと 話なんてしないんだ！ フン!!
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not talking to you evil Huma! Hmph!

Entry.JapaneseText: 薬がどこに売ってるかなんて どうして聞くんだよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Why would you ask me where to find medicine!?

Entry.JapaneseText: ボクがガジュマだから 知らないと思ってるんだろ！
Entry.EnglishText: I bet you think I don't know because I'm a gajuma, huh!?

Entry.JapaneseText: 知ってるやい！ そんなのは街はずれの商店で 買えるに決まってるんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: Well, I do know! Of course, everyone knows you can buy it at the shops on the outskirts of town!

Entry.JapaneseText: ボク、この前、 ヒューマに殴られた……
Entry.EnglishText: I got assaulted by a Huma the other day...

Entry.JapaneseText: なんでって聞いたら ボクがガジュマだからって 言ったんだよ！
Entry.EnglishText: I asked them, "Why me?" They told me it was because I'm a Gajuma!

Entry.JapaneseText: だからボクもヒューマなんて もっとキライになってやるんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: So because of that, I hate Huma even more!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマなんて 大ッキライなんだよ！ 近くに来るなよ!!
Entry.EnglishText: I hate you, Huma! Stay away from me!

Entry.JapaneseText: これ、何の音かな？ 地面も揺れてるみたいだし、 ボク、なんか怖いよ……
Entry.EnglishText: What's that sound? The ground seems to be shaking, and I'm kind of scared...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマなんて 大ッキライなんだよ！ 近くに来るなよ!!
Entry.EnglishText: I hate you, Huma! Stay away from me!

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダがなくなっちゃった って、ホントなの？ バルカもなくなっちゃうの？
Entry.EnglishText: Is it true that Razilda is gone? Is Balka going to be next?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマなんかラジルダと いっしょにいなくなっちゃえば よかったんだ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Huma should have disappeared along with Razilda!

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの兄ちゃんが帰って来ないんだ！ どこ行ったんだよ、兄ちゃん！
Entry.EnglishText: My brother's still out there! Where are you, bro!?
Entry.Notes: I rewrote the line and want it checked. previously it was "My brother's not coming home!" -dragon

Entry.JapaneseText: この街って、特に見るような ところなんかないよ。
Entry.EnglishText: There's nothing much to see in this town.

Entry.JapaneseText: お城の中はスゴイって言うけど…… ふつーの人は入れないもんね。
Entry.EnglishText: They say the inside of the castle is amazing, but... You can't go in there if you're just a normal person.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ジェラート屋台車』 お祭りなどの時に使われる屋台の車。 とてもおいしいジェラートで人気。 バビアロエ味がオススメ。 １ガルドコインで車体に 「ミル様命」と落書きされている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Gelato Cart - A food cart car used during festivals and other events. Very popular for its delicious gelato. The Baby Aloe flavor is recommended. From a 1 Gald coin, the car body is graffitied with "Mil's Life." <nl>
